comment_text: Gonna replace the vanilla essence with this for my pancake recipe

i was surprised to discover recently that minute amounts of skatole are often added to foodstuffs, particularly things flavoured with vanilla such as ice cream....apparently this is because of skatole's naturally pleasant floral aroma in very low concentrations but also because humans lack the ability to detect the smell of vanilla well when it's used alone in pure form and we can smell and taste it much better when minute amounts of animalic compounds like skatole are present alongside it.

After you crash out the skatole..... If the precipitate is what you are attempting to collect, why would you filter it through a cotton ball (and not an extremely fine-micron paper for instance)?

Wouldn't you only want to use a cotton ball if the filtrate liquid is what you need to recover? Using a cotton ball plug to recover a tiny solid precipitate sounds like a freaking nightmare..... Wouldn't much of the precipitate get caught in the cotton fibers making it near impossible to recover (aside from using solvents)?

Which begs the question. How did you recover the precipitate from the cotton plug? I would imagine you suffered decent mechanical losses no?

Use the Fischer Indole synthesis  to Make a indoxyl ester which can be hydrolysed to 2,2'-Bis(2,3-dihydro-3- oxoindolyliden)which can be brominated to Tyrian purple in anhydrous conditions to prevent oxidation 2,2'-Bis(2,3-dihydro-3- oxoindolyliden) can also be oxidised by nitric acid to 1H-indole-2,3-dione via double bond cleavage 1H-indole-2,3-dione can can then be oxidized to anthranilic acid by hydrogen peroxide via a Bayer villager like oxidation to a anhydride which is hydrolysed to a carbamic acid which undergoes a intramoleculer proton transfer to from the carboxyl group to the nitrogen to produce a unstable zwitterion which decomposes to anthranilic acid which can be converted to biphenylene using nitrosyl chloride via a diazonium and carbocation intermediate

Hi, I'm making my noise here As per your use of a compressed cotton ball in the funnel as a filter... Great idea! Kudos (applause), I went ghetto macguyver style making a filter. I am very limited right now on what I can do, experimentally, that is. I grabbed a tee shirt I wore on my way out of prison. I couldn't just throw the shirt away because I don't like wasting anything. I cut a six inch diameter circle and a bunch of one inch by eight inch strips, some to aid in the filtration, and some for a different project entirely. Anyways (sorry for the adhd tangents:), using a 20 inch plastic soda bottle that had been cut laterally, about five inches from the mouth of the bottle. (Sigh) yup, funnel. So this make-do funnel was stuffed with a folded six inch circle. I had cut it like that bc I thought I would make a couple coffee filter-like things but realized during a happy accident that the plug approach works very, very well. You take something dyed, like for example, skittles, crush them up mix with water and pour through the plug, which would take hours.. But what would come out would be close to clear, if blushing a little, like a white wine and sangria. Love love love your videos!

I think you added water too quickly so all product crushed out too fast, what you might want to try is put the crude in a vial (not the smallest and the big one you shown in video, a middle sized one), dissolve it in MeOH, then very carefully use pipette to drop one drop water just above the solvent line to make a temporaory two phase, the water will then diffuse slowly and your crystal should grow fine by this way. (Just like how you grow crystal for X-Ray crystallography)

comment_text: I commend you Sir on your determination to make the essence of poop.

Personally, I've been wanting to make 1,3-propandiol, which can be made by hydrating acrolein (according to wikipedia, that is... I need more research time lol). So I vote acrolein, and if you can, 1,3-propanediol.

"The essence of Poop" sounds like a great angsty teenager band name. Might have to steal that one... Awesome video as always, I was wondering what use you'd have for skatole when you mentioned it last time. Perhaps a stink bomb prank? Your channel is going places, and fast--the professionalism and attention to detail definitely make you stand out. You mentioned your garage being stunk up after the recrystallization, is that where you film your videos? I was under the impression you were filming in a lab setting for the most part. Cheers!
